attr.title: Minecraft - Java Edition
attr.desc:
Minecraft is a game where you can do pretty much whatever you want. Want to build a giant castle? Go for it. Feel like exploring caves and fighting skeletons? Totally an option. You start in a big, blocky world with nothing, and little by little, you gather, build, explore, and create your own adventures. Whether you're surviving the night or just chilling in Creative mode building dream houses, it’s a game about freedom, creativity, and having fun your own way.

Not all versions are Supported, currently only 1.7.10 (with Forge), 1.12 (with Forge) and 1.16.5 (Fabric only) are supported
attr.inst:
To play Minecraft on your device via PortMaster, you‚Äôll need to copy over the necessary game files from your PC. Follow these steps carefully:
‚úÖ Step 1: Prepare Minecraft on Your PC

    Install Minecraft on your PC via the official launcher.

    Launch the version you want to play at least once to make sure all files are generated.

    (Optional but important!)
    If you want to use a mod loader like Forge or Fabric, install it and launch that version once as well.

üìÇ Step 2: Find the Game Files

On your PC, Minecraft stores game files in this folder:

C:\Users\<YourUsername>\AppData\Roaming\.minecraft\versions

To access that folder Press the Windows Key on your Keyboard and R
    Win + R
You should see a new Window called Run, in there write %appdata% and press Enter

Now you should see a .minecraft directory

üìÅ Step 3: Copy to Your PortMaster Device

    Connect your device to your PC or insert the SD card.

    On your device, go to:

    /ports/minecraftjava

    Now copy the earlier found .minecraft Directory from Step 2 into the /ports/minecraftjava folder
    If it asks to overwrite files press NO !!!
